newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass sees Q1 loss of $0.10-$0.13/shr.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass sees Q1 loss of $0.10-$0.13/shr.

text.p: Spyglass Inc said it expects to report revenue of about $4 million and an earnings per share loss in the range of $0.10 to $0.13 for the first quarter ended December 31, 1996.

Spyglas said it does not expect to realize any revenue on the quarter from Microsoft Corp above a minimum quarterly payment due under a license agreement covering use of Spyglass software in Microsoft's Internet Explorer product.

Spyglass said "it is not able to determine the amount of royalties due from Microsoft in excess of the minimum payment because it has not received a royalty report with respect to the number of copies of Internet Explorer distributed by Microsoft."

Spyglass said that under the agreement, Microsoft agreed to pay royalties to Spyglass based on distribution of Internet Explorer. Spyglass said it intends to exercise its contractual right "to audit Microsoft's records to determine whether, and to what extent, additional royalties are owed to Spyglass."
Spyglass provides software and services to make devices work with the World Wide Web.
In the year-ago first quarter, the company said it posted earnings of $0.06 per share on revenues of $3.85 million.
